verses.kjv: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?
verses.ct: Around that time, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, "Who holds the highest position in the kingdom of heaven?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,
verses.ct: Jesus called a small child over and had the child stand among them.

verses.kjv: And said, Verily I say unto you, Except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.
verses.ct: Then he said, "Truly I tell you, unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.

verses.kjv: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
verses.ct: So whoever makes himself as humble as this child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

verses.kjv: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me.
verses.ct: And whoever welcomes a child like this on my behalf is welcoming me.

verses.kjv: But whoso shall offend one of these little ones which believe in me, it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck, and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea.
verses.ct: But if anyone causes one of these little ones who trust in me to stumble, it would be better for that person to have a heavy millstone tied around their neck and be thrown into the deep ocean.

verses.kjv: Woe unto the world because of offences! for it must needs be that offences come; but woe to that man by whom the offence cometh!
verses.ct: How terrible for the world because of the things that cause people to stumble! Such things are inevitable, but how terrible it will be for the person through whom they come!

verses.kjv: Wherefore if thy hand or thy foot offend thee, cut them off, and cast them from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into everlasting fire.
verses.ct: So if your hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It's better to enter life crippled or disabled than to have both hands and both feet and be thrown into eternal fire.

verses.kjv: And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast it from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire.
verses.ct: And if your eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away. It's better to enter life with one eye than to have both eyes and be thrown into the fire of hell.

verses.kjv: Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you, That in heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven.
verses.ct: Make sure you don't look down on any of these little ones. I'm telling you that their angels in heaven are always in the presence of my Father in heaven.

verses.kjv: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.
verses.ct: The Son of Man came to rescue those who are lost.

verses.kjv: How think ye? if a man have an hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains, and seeketh that which is gone astray?
verses.ct: What do you think? If a man owns 100 sheep and one of them wanders off, won't he leave the 99 on the hills and go searching for the one that strayed?

verses.kjv: And if so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth more of that sheep, than of the ninety and nine which went not astray.
verses.ct: And if he manages to find it, truly I tell you, he is happier about that one sheep than about the 99 that never wandered off.

verses.kjv: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.
verses.ct: In the same way, your Father in heaven does not want even one of these little ones to be lost.

verses.kjv: Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone: if he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.
verses.ct: If a fellow believer wrongs you, go and confront that person privately, just the two of you. If they listen to you, you've restored your relationship with them.

verses.kjv: But if he will not hear thee, then take with thee one or two more, that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.
verses.ct: But if they refuse to listen, bring 1 or 2 others along, so that every matter can be confirmed by the testimony of 2 or 3 witnesses.

verses.kjv: And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell it unto the church: but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican.
verses.ct: If the person still refuses to listen to them, bring it before the church. And if they won't listen even to the church, treat them as you would an outsider or a tax collector.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
verses.ct: Truly I tell you, whatever you prohibit on earth will be prohibited in heaven, and whatever you permit on earth will be permitted in heaven.

verses.kjv: Again I say unto you, That if two of you shall agree on earth as touching any thing that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of my Father which is in heaven.
verses.ct: I also tell you this: if 2 of you on earth agree together about anything you pray for, my Father in heaven will do it for you.

verses.kjv: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.
verses.ct: Because wherever 2 or 3 come together in my name, I am right there with them."

verses.kjv: Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? till seven times?
verses.ct: Then Peter approached him and asked, "Lord, how many times should I forgive someone who sins against me? As many as 7 times?"

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven times: but, Until seventy times seven.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Not 7 times — I tell you, 70 times 7.

verses.kjv: Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened unto a certain king, which would take account of his servants.
verses.ct: That's why the kingdom of heaven can be compared to a king who decided to settle accounts with his servants.

verses.kjv: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.
verses.ct: As he began the process, a man was brought before him who owed him 10,000 talents — an enormous debt.

verses.kjv: But forasmuch as he had not to pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to be made.
verses.ct: Since the man couldn't pay, the master ordered that he, his wife, his children, and everything he owned be sold to cover the debt.

verses.kjv: The servant therefore fell down, and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.
verses.ct: The servant dropped to his knees before him and begged, 'Please be patient with me, and I will pay back everything!'

verses.kjv: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him, and forgave him the debt.
verses.ct: The master felt deep compassion for that servant, so he released him and completely canceled his debt.

verses.kjv: But the same servant went out, and found one of his fellowservants, which owed him an hundred pence: and he laid hands on him, and took him by the throat, saying, Pay me that thou owest.
verses.ct: But that same servant went out and found a fellow servant who owed him 100 denarii — a relatively small amount. He grabbed him and started choking him, demanding, 'Pay me what you owe!'

verses.kjv: And his fellowservant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.
verses.ct: His fellow servant fell to his knees and pleaded, 'Please be patient with me, and I will pay you back!'

verses.kjv: And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay the debt.
verses.ct: But he refused. Instead, he had the man thrown into prison until the debt was paid in full.

verses.kjv: So when his fellowservants saw what was done, they were very sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that was done.
verses.ct: When the other servants saw what had happened, they were deeply upset. They went and reported the whole situation to their master.

verses.kjv: Then his lord, after that he had called him, said unto him, O thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou desiredst me:
verses.ct: So the master summoned the servant and said, 'You wicked servant! I canceled your entire debt because you begged me to.

verses.kjv: Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant, even as I had pity on thee?
verses.ct: Shouldn't you have shown the same mercy to your fellow servant that I showed to you?'

verses.kjv: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.
verses.ct: His master was furious and handed him over to be tortured until he could pay back everything he owed.

verses.kjv: So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses.
verses.ct: This is exactly what my heavenly Father will do to each of you if you don't genuinely forgive your brother or sister from your heart."
